intro: Ototropis megaphylla var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leafed false brome, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, glabrous stems and broad, lanceolate leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, white to greenish flowers appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. This variety is notable for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and woodland settings.
